column1: A small beach surrounded by a local village
column2:
Usually visitors don’t go to this beach as aksa beach is a good spot on this line which is near. But if you want to take a good healthy run then this place is ideal, nobody bothers you here.
Remember there are no shops nearby or on the beach, you have to get stuff from the main road or nearest village.

column1: Good place to go with family!!!
column2: Take the glass bottom. It comes with express pass. Also it's not very scary and actually exciting.Other activities are good too. 3D museum is a must. Enjoy food at food court if you want to have cheap and local food.

There are two things that makes this journey an unforgettable one. First the breathtaking view and second the calm and moist ambiance. When you gradually go up through the skyway you will start to feel the sheer beauty of it. If safety is an issue to you be rest assured that these meets the quality standard. So if you are in Malaysia, this skyway is should be in your Top 5 checklist

Your trip to Srinagar would be incomplete without a great culinary expertise at Adhoos. Oh! the meat would just melt in your mouth. And the bakery nearby will tickle your sensory pleasures while you dig in your meal. A must visit if you are in Srinagar

column1: Fun club and definitely worth going to!!!
column2: The reason I took off a star is because of the cigarette smoke. You’re allowed to smoke inside (so if you’re a smoker, great!) but if you’re not... it’s awful. I think if you’re going to allow smoking inside, you need a lot better ventilation than what they had. Glad I went, but I feel the need to warn any non-smokers.

column1: Queues can be a nightmare but some are really worth the wait!!!
column2: With the 4D cinema and active environment in the theatre, the experience is realy worth the wait. Staff is very helpful and the rides seem to be safe and secure. Testing is constantly done to ensure the experience of a lifetime. Food stalls, numerous entertainment inside and outside...for when you possibly arrive early, there is a lot of activities to ensure you forget about the everyday madness of your daily life routine. Take a weekend, take a week in the holiday times and spend some time to explore the fun and thrills.

I am running short of words after exploring the Hermitage museum. I could not see it fully, but what I witnessed is beyond explanation. You need the whole day to see the museum. You will find long queues of people waiting to explore the magnificent museum. It is worth watching and tickets usually start from 700 rubles. If you want to skip lines, tickets can cost you between $40-60. This place is highly recommended to visit but be ready to exhaust one day especially if you are on a short trip.

Fairly accessible by public transport (albeit a slight walk) and the gardens are beautiful. There is also a botanical garden that has an entry fee if you are interested. Plenty of benches along the park so a very nice place to have a snack or relax. Quite a few locals exercising through the park too. We saw some fish in the lakes and there is a gondola ride available too.

It's amazingly beautiful and is the highest point of Europe. You have to go to the mountain by the train starts everyday at 8:00 or 9:00 am to 16:00 pm and last train to return is at 18:43 pm. You probably need a whole day to completely enjoy the time at mountain. There are winter sports as well like skiing, zip line etc. There is a small ice cage also which is fully made of ice including the path. Must visit place.

column1: Beautiful palace with tons of history!
column2: There is so much to see, I recommend purchasing the all €13 ticket so you can see the theater, treasurery, and museum. It is full of amazing sculptures, paintings, tapestries, silver, gold, everything a king would have. All of the artifacts have been well cared for and preserved. Make sure you wear some comfortable walking shoes.

It’s really beautiful place. The grand Statue of Liberty is awe inspiring and humbling. It’s equally beautiful on all days and any time of the day. If you plan to take lot of pictures, then a sunny day would be best and the statue would look beautiful against the blue sky. The New York skyline is also visible from the shore and that is breath taking too. The audio tour they have is very informative and adds to the experience. The ferry is very convenient and has good frequency. When you wait in the queue for your ferry, make sure you are in the right queue. There are separate queue for new York bound tour and New Jersey bound tour. It easy to get confused and reach a wrong destination. Ellis island is also covered in the ferry tour and it has a good canteen too. The gift shop at the monument has great stuff and you are sure to find something in your budget. We took the ferry from New Jersey and it’s has ample paid parking close to the ferry. The 9/11 monument at the New Jersey ferry station is worth visiting as well.

column1: Take the day off and enjoy nature!!!!
column2:
Especially the snakes. The African green mamba is exquisite. There is nothing like the green and the black mamba, they will stare into your eye and catch your soul from behind the glass. It is an awesome experience staring into the eyes of the nature’s most aggressive killers.
Then there are the beautiful birds singing in most beautiful voices. It is peaceful. I had a lot of fun, I felt like a kid walking in the rain and enjoying the views of what God has created.
I would like to see more local Houston, Texas wildlife, insects, snakes, ants, etc in the zoo. I would love to contribute towards the local wildlife exhibits of Houston and/or Texas.
Thank you for a beautiful and a safe environment for everyone to enjoy.

So much fun! The rides and theme are great. Many of our favorites are there. The food and drinks were great. We never had a bad meal or snack. Harry Potter world is awesome. There are also so oldies but goodies. The kids area was so much fun with the foam ball room. The staff is helpful and kind. Much better than a coaster park

The atmosphere is one of inviting with rich history and fascinating exhibitions. It pays to arrive early or book ahead to avoid the queue. Suitable for all ages especially for children to explore. Wheelchair accessible entrance and parking. There's lavatory and gift shop. It has a lot to make you want to browse through all day.

I came here to hike alone without doing any prior research, so I was a bit nervous. The park rangers were very helpful. The scenery was lovely. The trails were fairly well marked. The parking was easy and convenient. There are lots of bathrooms spaced all around the park. They have an amazing gift shop and museum area. I did the sandstone trail and it was about 2.4 miles round trip. You walk in and walk back the same way you came in. It's a moderate hike. Just perfect for exercise but not being too strenuous.
column4: Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area

column1: Most beautiful theme park in LA
column2: The best place to visit with family for a wonderful time. Lots of awesome rides and things to do. Harry Potter world is their prime attraction. Transformers ride, Jurassic Park are next best. Do not miss the studio tour and do not forget to carry a good Camera as you will be clicking pics all day. Prepare to walk...a lot as this park is HUGE, but it is worth all of it as it is the most beautiful theme park in LA

This is a fabulous place to visit. Here it is better to be prepared for a long stay for there are many shops, attractions, and food. This is a busy mall, so it should be taken into consideration that it can be very crowded Thursday and Friday night. If you are here to have fun and spend some money, this is the place to go for that huge and beautifully designed mall. Big range of stores and a good food court.
Definitely a must see when you are in Dubai. The stores are for every price range and there are a lot of them.Some of the stores are expensive designer stores such as Tiffany's but also stores like Zara that are not expensive.

column1: Great view of sea and river merging together
column2:
Awesome place to spend time with friends and family. Great view of sea and river merging together. There is a childrens park and walkway for fun and morning job etc. Watching Sunset is a good experience. Enough parking place and lots of space to sit down and rest. Well maintained. A small lighthouse also situated inside the park (entry fees) for a better view.
Walkway towards sea is still in construction. People also come here for fishing.

Merlion is an iconic symbol of Singapore, and this is a great spot for a photograph! It can get quite crowded, but it doesn't take much of a wait to get a good photography spot. One on side you can take a photograph with Marina Bay Sands in the background, and this is probably the most popular spot so expect to wait.

The animals look well taken care of and they have room for the elephants to have a place for summer and winter environments.
My favorite part was probably the red pandas. They are adorable! They definitely bring in a crowd.
I know in the one day I visited, I only got to see 1/3 of the park. Also, the entrance to the zoo, I thought nobody was in there. I didn't see anyone loitering around. Inside, there was a fairly decent crowd.
Yes, I recommend a visit to this zoo.
Side note, you can view part of this zoo from the train while passing in and out of Rotterdam.

Beautiful place. A good view of palace however nobody is allowed inside. The guards are friendly. Beautiful garden with pretty flowers outside and an iconic place for photographs. Walk through the side corridors also feels good. Parking space is ample..

I am not sure how you rate a visit to a place of worship. Parking was free, which after the Moroccan experience concerning parking was refreshing. All of the employees seemed pleasant and eager to answer questions. There was definitely a feeling of peace & community surrounding the entire grounds from the people gathered within the immediate outside area to the people swimming in the sea and playing soccer, fishing and cooking on the boardwalk. Didn't have too much time in Casablanca but glad we stopped here for the experience.

The Casa Rosada is the executive mansion and office of the President of Argentina. The palatial mansion is known officially as Casa de Gobierno, ( "Government House"). Normally, the President lives at the Quinta de Olivos, the official residence of the President of Argentina, which is located in Olivos, Greater Buenos Aires. The characteristic color of the Casa Rosada is baby pink, and is considered one of the most emblematic buildings in Buenos Aires. The building also houses a museum, which contains objects relating to former presidents of Argentina. It has been declared a National Historic Monument of Argentina.

La Sagrada Familia is absolutely stunning. The moment you first step out of the metro and turn to look at it, it definitely took my breathe away. The details and the sheer size of it is incredible. I bought my tickets in advance and was able to walk around before my tour. I highly recommend doing the tour as there is so much information and history about this church. People said that the best time to visit the Sagrada Familia was during sunset...they were right.

A beautiful and impressive reconstructed castle. Although the castle opens at 9 am, you can go earlier and take your time for pictures in the surrounding area. The entrance to the main castle is 600 yen. There is an elevator that can take you to the top of the castle where you will enjoy a nice view of the city. Alternatively you can take the stairs. Highly recommend.

Grandiose architectural masterpiece, 102 story 1250 feet(380m) a total of 1454 feet (443.2 m) including its antenna, spectacular building was finished May 1 st. 1931. It was a farm field in 18 century before came to the possession of prominent family Waldorf Astoria who built hotel there and later relocated hotel to Park Avenue where still stands fabulous hotel Waldorf Astoria. 3500 people mostly Italian and Irish immigrants built Empires State building around the clock, finished in 14 months, 45 days before scheduled date. Contains 10 million bricks and 5 acres of windows.
It’s named after New York State nickname ‘Empire State’. When you are there you’ve been transported to times imagining people transforming this real estate to timeless, iconic landmark that offers 360 views of mesmerizing city. Breathtaking views are fantastic just like New York itself. Over 250 movies were filmed there King King in 1933 being the first one. It has been popular tourist attraction since opening. Over 4 million people a year enjoy spectacular views and amazingly magnificent landmark. If you are lucky to find yourself at 102 story observatory deck soaking the spirits of majestic, spectacular New York City count your blessings, being on the top of the highest building you will visit in you lifetime, crown jewel of American history visited by many Kings, Queens, Presidents, dignitaries and you is truly a blessing.

Amazing romantic place with very friendly and willing staff, nice large rooms with minibar, coffeemaker and kettle. Pool outside and inside, whirpool etc. Child friendly :), very tasty food and large choice during the breakfast. Absolutely the best choice for having a rest.

Space well maximized, beautifully designed with touch of colourful light all through. Standard car park and all accessible entrance and elevator access. It's one of the great places to lodge in when visiting Nigeria for the first time and looking forward to having a full feel of African serenity...
Nice bar, great continental and African dishes and you can also hold your events here too...

The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable, and the exhibits are of excellent quality! The keepers clearly love what they do, and are invested in the welfare of the animals, and wildlife conservation. A truly fantastic and educational experience! The dolphin celebration, and sea lion splash are outstanding. There are also many encounters to add on, and these are the ultimate amazing experiences to learn and love aquarium creatures. Highly recommend!

I was blown away by this place. The staff was fantastic and gave me an awesome recommendation. Met the owner and he was a true gentleman. Then the food arrived, it was awesome. Blew away my expectations even when I was dying from eating a red pepper lol. Great staff, excellent food, and exceptional management. Can't say enough about this place. Don't go in expecting the world and you'll be in a for a great time!

column1: One of the top Chinese restaurants.
column2:
Been here twice, food is quite good as they have their own style. Crispy pork is highly recommended, definitely one of the best. As for Peking Duck, they have HK-style which is a different twist as most are served differently (skin only). It does taste kinda nice for a change. Excellent display in slicing duck.
Be selective in choosing dessert though, most are good but some are mediocre.
Overall, one of the top Chinese restaurants.

Outstanding Italian restaurant using a semi-buffet concept. You can get antipasti yourself from the buffet, then order wine and a main course from your table, followed by a visit to their extraordinarily well-stocked cheese room (definitely worth a visit!), and help yourself to some dessert. Prices vary on the number of courses you go for.

They have a varying menu with seasonal specials, and offer a very high standard of Italian food. The wine list is also quite accessible, even when on somewhat of a budget.

Hotel Arctic has 76 rooms and 9 suites. In addition the hotel has 5 Aluminium "Igloos" built right on the edge of the coast and connected to the hotel by a 75 metre boardwalk. The "Igloo" cabins are inspired by the classic "Eskimo" igloo in shape and design but instead of being made of ice they have an aluminium frame so that when you step inside you are greeted by comfortable and modern facilities like any other hotel room - but the atmosphere is totally different.

The atmosphere was hostile for me and my family. They were very rude and uncooperative. Kindly stop endorsing them. Their room key was cracked and when it broke they blamed my family for it and asked for money. No room service was provided. When we asked for our share of complimentary drinking water they rudely asked us to go and buy it from a departmental store and when we said it’s included in our stay, they taunted us and said we cannot afford to buy water. Kindly look into the matter.

column1: Another temple on the East Bank of the river Nile.
column2:
Luxor Temple is another temple on the East Bank of the river Nile.
This is a huge site and wear suitable flat shoes if you are going to visit the site. Our visit was early morning with a tour guide which I would highly recommend as otherwise you would have no idea what you are looking at.
Our guide gave us time to explore ourselves as well as providing us with lots of really useful historical facts and details.

Perfect is not easy to achieve – somehow this place does it with ease, style, and grace. We rented all five rooms for a family Christmas in Paris 2018. We had the entire place to ourselves. Ilhame and her family and staff truly made us feel very warmly welcomed and at home. Everything you want to see or do is within 10 minutes of this location. Walk to the Eiffel tower, shops, restaurants, the neighborhood is safe and beautiful. The building is over 100 years old and beautifully restored. The staff, the attention to detail, and the commitment to quality service is exceptional. If you are travelling to Paris – it’s hard to imagine finding a better place than this. Thank you Ilhame for a great stay at your place.

Super clean, beautiful room, amazing service. We've stayed at four different places in Bali. From $80 per night (this one) to $450 per night and this one is my favourite by far. It's actually cleaner than the more expensive places. It's only a 10 minute walk to Ubud markets too. Highly recommend!

Palacio de La Moneda (Palace of La Moneda) Commonly known as La Moneda, it is the seat of the President of the Republic of Chile. It also houses the Ministry of Interior and Public Security, the General Secretariat of the Presidency, the General Secretariat of Government and the Ministry of Social Development. It is located in the commune of Santiago. The Moneda Palace is the only pure Italian neoclassical style building in America. The Palace has its main façade on Moneda Street, overlooking the Plaza de la Constitución, under which parking lots and offices were built for different dependencies of the presidency and the ministries that are there. This place is popularly called ‘the Bunker’

What a magnificent place to be. It’s magical, like something out of the movies. Surrounded by these monumental architecture draped with gold ornaments actually made a great sight seeing visit. There are countless chocolate stores, lots of bars and restaurants, horse and carriages, pigeons, stalls and lots of tourists :) Street waffles on pop up vans, pop up artists playing instruments surrounding the area. The weather was beautiful and walking round the square was a highlight.

This is a historical place. You will see a few forts. This will remind you old Dhaka when is was not crowded. Spending a few hours specifically if you like to walk or time pass, this is the right place. After noon is busy time and Friday it becomes the busiest pub gathering place This place is safe. There is a juice ship opposite to the Mosque with huge number of options, don't miss it.

This temple is one of the oldest temples in Colombo and is also a tourist attraction point. The temple is situated in a very calm and peaceful environment and it's freely accessible to anyone (for tourists I think they may have to pay some entry fee) . It's very much suitable for meditation and as well as other religious activities.
It's suggested to visit the temple wearing appropriate apparel.

Went to the One Piece park inside the Tokyo Tower. There are several ticket purchase options. If you want to see the actual tower, you need to buy the tickets on the first floor-there are combo one piece and tower tickets. If you just want to see the One Piece park - get your tickets on the 3rd floor. You can choose just a park entrance ticket or an entrance ticket plus the live show. The park entrance tickets were 2300 yen. I believe 3300 for the ticket plus the show. The show comes on every 2 hours starting at noon.
I can't say the park itself was worth the money.. It was very interesting to see everything. It's fun to go once for experience sake. It's kind of like a museum with stations with games in between. We chose not to watch the show bc...no subs.

If you call yourself a tourist, don’t miss this wonder. Don’t forget the camel ride. Don’t go for horse option, camel ride is another world. Learn the technique to sit on a camel and you will be fine. Take drinks with you. Don’t buy anything from vendors selling cold drinks inside the pyramid area. They might sell you a Pepsi bottle for &100 and then a crowd will appear to support their claim. Always ask the price before touching anything in Cairo and Giza.

A view of history, for millenia, through the vision of Chinese artists. The works very between classical simplicity to the incredibly detailed. Restoration is an art in itself, and is performed with amazing attention to details.
The multi-story museum is artfully organized. Each of the many rooms tell a story. Large and small objects are presented with care and consideration.
Elevators and escalators provide easy wheelchair access.
The gift shop is large containing both inexpensive and exquisitely detailed glass and porcelain.
The entire facility is wheelchair accessible and that includes western style bathrooms.

Wow. Wow. Wow. I would give unlimited stars if I could! I booked fast track for an evening view of London, and I was not disappointed. While fast track did cost more, me and my boyfriend were straight past the long line, searched and into a pod within six minutes of arriving. Well worth the extra money in my opinion. But the views? Simply breathtaking. Seriously, the pictures and videos don't do justice. It's so peaceful being that high up, yet you see the city still bustling below. The pod has so many clear windows for excellent photo opportunities and is spacious enough for many people inside without feeling claustrophobic. The pace was just right and not once did I feel uncomfortable. I've seen people saying this is a "tourist trap", but I couldn't disagree more. As a Brit myself, I can't recommend you do this attraction enough and hopefully it will shine a light onto why I'm raving about it so much. A truly unforgettable, spectacular experience

I loved this place! One of my favorites places at Toronto. It's totally worth it! I loved the tunnel, you can see sharks and turtles over your head, it was a unique experience. However the aquarium it's a bit small, you can see all the aquarium in under an hour. I would definitely come back if there's new sections or species.

column1: A vast variety of cultural objects!!!
column2:
A vast variety of cultural objects spread over 3 floors from every part of the world. Chinese & Japanese to European and everything in between. The dinosaur exhibition is fantastic as well. The nature hands-on section is perfect for children.
It is recommended getting there early as it can get busier later in the day, plus it can take several hours if you decide to take your time.
column4: Skip the Line: Royal Ontario Museum Ticket

column2: Is the model of the gate of Ishtar built by the professor Taha Baqer in (1960) has been built in this place to be in front of the visitor and the first landmark to meet, which is the most important symbol of the city of Babylon and its location in the middle of the city and decorated with symbols of two gods (Murdoch-Adad) I It is the god of nature and is the main god in the city has collected the qualities of nature in the earth and the sky and water and forest and desert, headed by a fabulous animal and his body as the body of the fish and the tail of a snake tail and the front legs of the lion and the background of the bird of punishment. The second god is the god of thunder, lightning and moisture.

This is a beautiful palace and lots of details in it. Its being maintained very well. It’s a must to learn the history behind it and use the information that they provide to you once you buy your entrance ticket. The inside and outside of this palace are both amazing. If you are in Tehran, visit here with Grand Bazaar and perhaps the National jewels museum (check the hours as it’s limited) on the same day.

Amazing experience. It is huge and has a massive variety of rides and attractions to cater to all kinds of people be it kids, adventurous adults and more laid back (read as scary cats) ones.
The roller coasters are the main attraction. They give a tremendous adrenaline rush.
Food outlets offer decent food but charge exorbitant prices. Well, it is to be expected from such a place.
All in all, had a lot of fun. Highly recommended.

The best place to go in Qatar. Very high class. The view is exceptional. The restaurants are amazing. The cars are astonishing. The things you can see, find and do there are limitless. Advised to go there food every person living or visiting Qatar.

column1: Huge, beautiful and with historic importance!!!
column2:
It is a glimpse into the great leader ho chi minhs life during the Vietnam war. It is a stark contrast to the huge independence palace used by south Vietnam's leaders.
The palace is beautiful.
Do not carry lighters as security check will not let it pass.
Food, drinks available inside.
Few souvenir shops.
Clean bathrooms.
No need of a guide.

Excellent. I think it's wonderful. Clean,welcoming from the arrival to departure. Respectful staff,always happy to offer assistance. Great breakfast buffet. Will stay here in the future.
Room was clean,comfortable and could easily make it my home.
Close to the lake and other attractions. Well done

column1: Best place for families with kids!!!
column2:
Sea World is one of the best places for families with kids to visit. There are so many things to see and experience at this attraction. They also have impressive shows, like the dolphins show and the seal show. Lots of parking spaces, ambulant parking, things to eat, merchandise to buy, etc.
The display of different species of water animals is excellent. They also provide a good nap of the entire experience. Enjoyed the ride on the overhead coach. The rides were also quite impressive. They've got toilets and spaces for eating. All in all, it was a fabulous experience.

I really enjoyed my stay at Boutique Hotel in Budapest. The room was modern, clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff were helpful and provided great options of places to eat, helped me print my boarding pass for my flight and were generally kind and helpful. The breakfast was pretty good with plenty of options.

Ambiance is warm, bright and tastefully decorated. It is easily approachable for people with wheel chairs. Hotel is located near the city center. Nearest Metro station is a 4-minute walk and 2.3 km from landmark Red Square.
There are 2 restaurants serving international and modern European cuisine, plus a lobby bar. Other amenities include an souvenir shop, a spa and a fitness center, as well as meeting and event space.
Staff at reception desk and concierge desk are helpful and speak English.

A True Value for money.Attendants are courteous and attentive. The room was maintained clean and the continental breakfast that they offer is satisfying. Extra-mile service for the luggage keeping on our check-out is such a great help.Keep up the good job!

When in Manila, Philippines you should come stop to see Fort Santiago. If you like museums and history this is one stop for you. But even if you don’t, it’s one of the historical places you’ll come to see in the Philippines. You can spend a God’s half of the day here. Although, they are still in the process of restoring some spots, you can see that it has been maintained. The architectural structure and characteristics are still visible from back in the day.
Here at Fort Santiago you can take a tour guide, a ride on a horse carriage, have some food, and shop at their cute little stores. The staff are very friendly and the entrance fee is close to nothing when you convert to US Dollars. We really enjoyed our time here. Very educational. You can learn about the history of Jose Rizal ( a national hero). And see photographs of the past.

column1: Great part of United States history!!
column2: Great part of United States history in Philadelphia. It was commissioned from London in 1752. It has written in it “Proclaim LIBERTY Throughout all the Land unto all the Inhabitants Thereof". It’s a free attraction but you may have to wait in line 30 minutes or so depending on what day and time you do. Weekdays and non-holidays it’s usually less busy. The park outside it’s also a nice area to relax and it’s proximity to Independence Hall it’s also nice since you can visit both.
